item.description:
Hi Everyone,

 

So far the weather and river flow conditions look good for the first actual group-wide paddle event of the year.

At this time all 7 of my yaks are reserved and no more carry capacity.

 

AS ALWAYS --ANY EVENT LISTING DEPENDS ON PREDICTED AND CURRENT WEATHER CONDITIONS ALONG WITH WATER FLOW CONDITIONS AT THE INTENDED SITE.

 

I will be wearing my BRIGHT ORANGE HUNTING HAT near the boat put in spot.

----------------------

 

Hi Everyone,

BOTH Me and my My  Buddy on the "LEFT"  (its not Obama stepping off of Air Force One's stair ramp) are yelling at you to get you Kayaks out  and get you big fat butts moving on the water.

 

It is time for a first GROUP paddle event of the season.

 

 

 

 

It is  Flat Water, generally a low current, river to marsh, and lake environments.

Please wear your life jacket for this and every paddling event.

-

The Dam area below is the destination point for a walk around view and rest stop.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

On the return its through the "marshes track" on the right for a different view of the river. (optional trip up river for all paddlers as we begin since this is a short paddle event but you can head downstream if you want, we will catch up at the Dam).

Bring your Pot Luck Food and beverages along with a comfortable chair for the Real Wood Fireside Pot Luck BBQ after the paddle event concludes.

We will set up right on site in the big field for the BBQ.

-

Check the following links:

Willimantic River FLOW rate:

http://waterdata.usgs.gov/ct/nwis/uv?cb_00060=on&format=gif_default&period=&begin_date=2013-03-31&end_date=2013-04-07&site_no=01119500

-

For the latest update on weather: http://www.usairnet.com/cgi-bin/launch/code.cgi?Submit=Go&sta=KIJD&state=CT

-

-----------------------------------------

Getting to the Put in Spot:

Willimantic River Put In <----(apx location map link)

FOLLOW THESE DIRECTIONS..because there are 2 Plains Roads in the area.

From Hartford: take I 84 east to exit 59 onto I - 384 EAST....

When I - 384 ends at rte 6 and 44 split ..take the left split = rte 44 EAST....

go for 7.8 miles (just past Mansfield Depot) and turn right (South) onto rte 32 (Stafford Rd)

go apx 0.36 miles then take a right on to PLAINS RD.

Go about 0.25 miles just past the RR tracks and take a right into the boat ramp+parking area just before the Willi River Bridge.

apx. GPS, to get close to Plains Road: use 1210 Stafford Road, Storrs - Mansfield , CT

====================================

KAYAKS AVAILABLE:

The following Kayaks come with top rated paddles and life jackets transported to the put in site but must be specifically chosen and reserved in advance:

Boat use Doughnation is $20.00

Note: if you reserve a kayak and i take it all the way to the site and you do not show -- you will never join us again for any event.

These are my personal hobby boats and its asked you be sincere in showing up, besides i ask less than half of what a local shop charges and you get better equipment right at the event site's boat ramp.

Yes i will understand  traffic may cause you to be late and if i hear of of any traffic via my GPS or by other arriving members, then we usually wait a bit longer than normal.

Please make sure you fit in the boats and have some paddling skills (check the info of the boats in the corresponding links provided with each boat).

 

KAYAK #1:       Eddyline Wind Dancer Fiberglass+Kevlar, Red, Rudder Equipped 18' @ 24" wide.

This is an expedition style sea kayak designed for heavy loads and can handle rough sea conditions.

Highly stable (initial & secondary), heavy weight (52 LB).       
For almost any sized paddler apx (100 to 230 lbs) with beginner and up skills.

http://www.epinions.com/otdr_Kayaking_Touring_Sea-Eddyline-Wind_Dancer

---> RESERVED FOR SANDEEP

 

KAYAK #2:       Necky Eliza Plastic, Fire Color, Rudder Equipped 15'-3.5'' @ 22"wide.

Transitional *Recreation to Sea Kayak*, moderate weight (49 LB) ladies kayak       
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 160 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the heavier model and largest cockpit of the Eliza series.  http://www.neckykayaks.com/kayaks/touring/eliza_polymer/

---> - RESERVED FOR DURELLE

 

 

KAYAK #3:     Necky Eliza Advanced Composite (Un Modified), Red and White, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide.

Transitional *Recreation to Sea Kayak*,  Light weight (45 LB) Ladies Kayak.

Small to Medium sized paddler (95 - 145 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the medium size cockpit of the Eliza series.

http://www.neckykayaks.com/kayaks/touring/eliza_composite/

---> RESERVED FOR CATE

 


KAYAK #4:       Necky Eliza Composite Special Ultra Light Version (Modified)

(Very Thin Fibreglass), Yellow, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide.

Transitional *Recreation to Sea Kayak*, Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak.       
Small to Medium sized paddler (95 - 145 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the lightest of the Eliza Series and also with the smallest cocpit.

http://playak.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&catid=5010:boats&id=2150:Eliza-Ultralite

http://www.neckykayaks.com/press_room/press_releases/eliza_paddlerspick/

---> BEING REPAIRED --- will be AVAILABLE for this event

-----> RESERVED FOR Liangfang



KAYAK #5:    Wood Cedar Strip Night Heron by Guillemot Kayaks, Fixed Skeg 18' @ 20" wide.

Overall a stable and predictable Sea Kayak with a hard chine, low rocker Greenland style hull, heavy weight (50 lbs).

Medium Sized Paddler (apx 100 - 200 Lbs) with NOVICE/INTERMEDIATE and up skills.

http://www.guillemot-kayaks.com/guillemot/node/51/details

Additional Option:

Greenland style Paddle available also if specifically REQUESTED.

http://www.cricketdesigns.com/greenland.htm .

---> BEING REPAIRED -- will be AVAILABLE for this event

----> RESERVED FOR MARY BETH

 

KAYAK #6:        NDK Greenlander Pro,  Fiberglass, Red, Skeg Equipped. Greenland style, fast kayak for ocean crusing. 18' @ 21" wide,  heavy weight 50 lb

Full Greenland style sea kayak. Medium sized paddler (100-175 lbs) with  a MINIMUM of Intermediate to Advanced sea paddling skills needed for this boat.

http://www.maineislandkayak.com/ndk_greenlander.html#greenlanderpro

---> AVAILABLE if you can handle it.

RESERVED FOR AL FROM WILLIMANTIC


Kayak #7:   THE HOME DEPOT WOODEN SPECIAL,

16 FEET LONG, 23 INCH WIDE. ALL THE COMFORTS OF HOME INSTALLED.

---> RESERVED FOR THE PITCHFORK WIELDING PADDLING MOTIVATOR.

 

I wish you all a good day..

al-r

item.name: MAY 4 - Kayaking Startup Paddle & Fireside Pot Luck BBQ @ Dilleverance River
